page.title: 02Rivers and Roads
page.content:
There are a number of small streams as well as the{River Harbourne}in the area. These all contribute to the waters of the{River Dart,}which has its main source on Dartmoor. There is now a bridge over the Harbourne but the village grew up around the fording place, hence the name,{Harbertonford.} The ford is maintained as a pleasant feature of the village, though it is no longer used.
The only major road through the area is the Totnes to Kingsbridge road. All the other roads are single track {lanes.} There are quite a few places where the roads are wide enough for two vehicles to pass comfortably.
